posts.cooked:
We’re releasing the Signal 7.73 beta soon.

If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group here.

Using Obtanium? Remember to opt-in for pre-release tags to receive beta updates.

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

  • Rebuild camera implementation for improved reliability.
  • Improve performance of first send to large group.
  • Fix attachment downloads getting stuck after a call ends.
  • Fix keyboard not opening reliably when system animations are disabled.

Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.72 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.73.0 (164500)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

50 new commits since 7.72.2:

Show commits

  • Rebuild CameraXFragment to use a brand new camera. [1]

  • Bump to libsignal v0.86.15 [2]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.63.0 [3]

  • Move the org.signal.glide code inside signal-android into lib/glide. [4]

  • Move UriGlideRenderer to lib:image-editor. [5]

  • Fix benchmark compilation error. [6]

  • Local backups upgrade UI. [7]

  • Update exoplayer version to 1.9.1 [8]

  • Switch to using SurfaceView for ExoPlayer. [9]

  • Fix broken exoplayer pool test. [10]

  • Add group member label editing screen. [11]

  • Rename Groups.proto modifyMemberLabel field to modifyMemberLabels. [12]

  • Attempt to remove an android datatransport service. [13]

    Relates to #14556

  • Fix attachment downloads stuck after call ending. [14]

  • Fix instrumentation test compilation. [15]

  • Add key transparency backend support. [16]

  • Allow opting out of key transparency. [17]

  • Fix crash when user local can't resolve to a currency in post-restore job. [18]

  • Convert SentMediaQuality to kotlin. [19]

  • Convert PartUriParser into Kotlin. [20]

  • Add basic re-reg support to regV5. [21]

  • Add a github distribution variant. [22]

  • Fix type and type annotations issues in reproducible script. [23]

    Resolves #14573

  • Fix memory usage in reproducible-build GitHub workflow. [24]

    Resolves #14574

  • Do not stop reproducible comparison at the first mismatch. [25]

    Resolves #14570

  • Fix type comparison in reproducible script. [26]

    Resolves #14571

  • Move blurhash to its own module. [27]

  • Cycle view focus if keyboard fails to open. [28]

  • Self-check key transparency. [29]

  • Remove unused dependency in Util. [30]

  • Add KT to backups. [31]

  • Add animations to key transparency. [32]

  • Rotate the cameraXModelBlocklist. [33]

    We think the new camera could solve all or most of our issues, so let's
    start fresh.

  • Enable key transparency for internal users. [34]

  • Bump to libsignal v0.87.0 [35]

  • Add media send feature module. [36]

  • Don't send group update messages when member labels are changed. [37]

  • Move lru and bottomsheet util to core modules. [38]

  • Add more checks when doing KT. [39]

  • Add internal setting to run KT. [40]

  • Update translations to support multiple modules. [41]

  • Improve performance of first send to large group. [42]

  • Fix baseline profile generation and update it. [43]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.64.1 [44]

  • Utilze localized description for calculating badge line count. [45]

  • Move text styles to core UI. [46]

  • Move several Permissions dependencies to core. [47]

  • Ensure that notification heuristics are calculated in the background. [48]

  • Update translations and other static files. [49]

  • Bump version to 7.73.0 [50]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.72.2…v7.73.0

Localization changes

Note: after clicking a link, it may take a few seconds before GitHub jumps to the file (try scrolling a bit if it doesn’t).

At least 66 languages changed since 7.72.2:

For technical reasons, not all languages may be listed below. However, everything from “Updated language translations” and similar commits is listed, so the list is likely complete. You can view the full comparison to 7.72.2 so far here.

link_counts.title: Get the latest Android releases even faster with Firebase App Distribution
Key Transparency is coming to Signal?

posts.name: AlertSubject
posts.cooked:
New camera, nice!! Let’s hope this fixes some of the older bugs

Nice to see the different lenses being supported now

  • First issue in having is that when I record a video and start zooming in, it’ll begin to switch to wide lens once the zooming begins - while the viewfinder was in the normal lens before. So zooming in begins with zooming out due to the lens changing

  • And when you zoom in very far the image suddenly turns very dark and shifts. Can reproduce any time I zoom in very far. It becomes grainy and “pulses” looks a bit different every second

  • Click to focus doesn’t seem to work reliably, especially in low light

  • Enabling flash and then recording a video doesn’t record with flash

  • Doubleclick to switch cameras doesn’t work (standard behavior on almost all apps)

  • Using selfie flash should increase screen brightness temporarily otherwise it doesn’t work

  • Taking a photo with selfie cam and then backing out resets the camera to main camera. Should probably remain in the last used camera until fully existed at least

  • The “hitbox” for the flash toggle seems a bit small, i often miss it when in a hurry. Feels like it’s just a tiny bit smaller than the icon itself (?)

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.73.0/1e69674ccf215dc29967497de0c7b2faee83358a06bd66faf43aea164bc4581e

posts.name: Salt
posts.cooked:
If I start recording from my rear camera and then switch to front while recording, the camera becomes unavailable.

Logs: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.73.0/dc54851aac40685d7c74e802d71d9b7fb64fa89440f4c0dcc867c4a5ce4a1bb1

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Crash when trying to apply a member label in a group where I am not an admin.

posts.name: Salt
posts.cooked:
Is the member label setting supposed to be active yet? I set one but it doesn’t appear to be working.

Also, the emoji preview is using the system emoji rather than the Signal/Apple ones

Screenshot_20260204-1734341080×482 15.4 KB

Logs: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.73.0/c1a8ee0ccd601c40f831398e2d47ee7f4fd6493d49317d6bed331895f727e739

AlertSubject:
  • First issue in having is that when I record a video and start zooming in, it’ll begin to switch to wide lens once the zooming begins - while the viewfinder was in the normal lens before. So zooming in begins with zooming out due to the lens changing
  • And when you zoom in very far the image suddenly turns very dark and shifts. Can reproduce any time I zoom in very far. It becomes grainy and “pulses” looks a bit different every second
  • Click to focus doesn’t seem to work reliably, especially in low light
  • Enabling flash and then recording a video doesn’t record with flash
  • Doubleclick to switch cameras doesn’t work (standard behavior on almost all apps)
  • Using selfie flash should increase screen brightness temporarily otherwise it doesn’t work
  • Taking a photo with selfie cam and then backing out resets the camera to main camera. Should probably remain in the last used camera until fully existed at least
  • The “hitbox” for the flash toggle seems a bit small, i often miss it when in a hurry. Feels like it’s just a tiny bit smaller than the icon itself (?)

Tracking these, thanks!

Salt505:

If I start recording from my rear camera and then switch to front while recording, the camera becomes unavailable.

Tracking

Whatnoww:

Crash when trying to apply a member label in a group where I am not an admin.

Oops that feature wasn’t supposed to be enabled yet but please send a debug log so we can investigate the crash!

Salt505:

Is the member label setting supposed to be active yet? I set one but it doesn’t appear to be working.

The feature was enabled prematurely - it’s not expected to work fully yet in 7.73.

Salt505:

Also, the emoji preview is using the system emoji rather than the Signal/Apple ones

Thanks, we’ll take a look!

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.73.0/c5e7c185631a356d1792bc65f99fca405f10d2b06e1ded5bb21d0420a8b0a1b0

posts.name: AlertSubject
posts.cooked: The sticker row bug is still present in the latest beta

Having an issue with typing only in signal. Using the default Gboard on my pixel.

This started a little while ago (weeks?) only when I was texting myself (note to self), so I figured it was the keyboard being goofy, but now it’s intermittently happening when I’m texting any thread in signal. The keyboard will stop autocorrecting, swiping a word stops halfway through and doesn’t type anything, etc. When I tried to insert an emoji, it flashed back to the main qwerty keys almost immediately. I think what’s happening is the keyboard is just being reloaded again and again and again. Maybe signal is calling for the keyboard to show up repeatedly, like the first time you tap on a text field? This doesn’t happen in any other app.

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.73.0/aafd223fb21358ec463cebd07f6d4e427fa5d0f1865d51d01e873543e2051d1c

While navigating back from a chat, the keyboard appears if the back gesture is held briefly, then released, and the gesture is swiped again. This issue does not occur on the main chats list screen.

Here’s the screen recording: Proton Drive
Also provide a debug log.

I’m also seeing some weird keyboard behavior. Just now I opened Signal out of multitasking and the keyboard appeared when I went back to the conversation list view. The keyboard I use is Gboard.

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.73.0/99391273aa1d699db0d52edacb55a69193b4a492016b0e2da56ed5d94fb3bc15

New Version: 7.73.1 (164600)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

11 new commits since 7.73.0:

Show commits

  • Block camera switching during video recording. [1]

  • Add double-tap gesture on viewfinder to switch cameras. [2]

  • Persist camera lens selection across sessions. [3]

  • Fix video recording zoom starting at ultrawide instead of 1x. [4]

  • Fix tap-to-focus using wrong coordinate space in new camera. [5]

    We were using raw coordinates. Now we transform them appropriately
    to the correct coordinate space.

  • Enable torch during video recording in new camera. [6]

  • Maximize screen brightness during selfie flash in new camera. [7]

  • Increase flash toggle button hitbox in new camera. [8]

  • Check audio permission before enabling audio in video recording. [9]

  • Update translations and other static files. [10]

  • Bump version to 7.73.1 [11]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.73.0…v7.73.1

posts.name: AlertSubject
posts.cooked:
I feel like that was a whole release just for my reports

updates-bot:

Block camera switching during video recording.

Buuut could we get camera switching during recordings?

That would be really nice if technically possible. Makes sharing moments a lot more personal

posts.name: fr33tux
posts.cooked:

I’ve been having this same issue for a number of weeks. Using Heliboard as my keyboard.

However, the issue isn’t as bad as when I first came across it. It seems to have improved over recent versions. Around the New Year maybe it happened quite regularly and would start to eat up memory on my phone and Signal would become almost unresponsive and would necessitate a restart of my phone. This element of the problem seems to have been resolved and is now just the appearance of the keyboard and some slight sluggishness for a second or two.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
Just an issue I had today once. When I opened the Signal emoji keyboard, I got no option to switch to GIF or stickers.

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.73.1/6e386f84972bd22a6d99af1841240f2d3444ea75c04ce74c23eb355126566911

image1024×2279 74.9 KB

Only a force close made it come back.
